Android mobile application for converting images to black-and-white nonogram. You can:
 - Select an image from the gallery or take a photo
 - Crop and rotate selected image
 - Select size of nonogram
 - Save nonogram and its thumbnail
 - Share nonogram and its thumbnail
Application converts selected image to a nonogram, which has a single logical solution.
If you have any questions,\nplease contact us:\n nonoconverter@gmail.com

The process of converting pictures into Japanese Crossword is divided into three sections, presented below. To read more about each of them, you must click on the icon on the left. On each screen (except the main screen), it is possible to go back by clicking on the standard \'back\' button in the navigation bar or on the \'back\' button in the upper left corner on the action bar.
Upload images from the gallery and receive photos from the camera.
Rotation, flipping, and cropping of a picture. Setting the sizes of the crossword.
Before the picture is converted into a Japanese Crossword, it needs to be uploaded.
To load an image into the application, you need to click on the \'LOAD IMAGE\' button on the main screen, then you will go to the screen to select an image.

All images on the device are presented in the form of folders in which they are located. When you click on a particular folder, all the images that are in it appear. When you click on a specific image, it is loaded into the application.

Also available to receive a photo from the camera. To do this, in the upper right corner on the action bar you need to click on the camera icon and the camera will open. After that, you can take a picture.

After selecting an image from the gallery or photo, you will be taken to the screen to process the loaded image.
After loading the image, it can be cropped or rotated 90 degrees. To convert an image into the Japanese Crossword, you need to set the dimensions of the crossword.

To crop, rotate and flip the image, click on the 'CROP' button in the lower left corner.

You can rotate the image 90, 180 and 270 degrees and flip the image horizontally. To do this, click on the icons at the bottom.

You can crop the image by selecting the desired rectangle. To fixate your choice, you need to click on the check mark in the upper right corner on the action bar

To set the size of the crossword, click on the \'SETTINGS\' button in the lower right corner.\n\nYou can view an approximate result. Also you can see current size and range of possible sizes after converting above image. There is a slider that provides a choice of the number of columns at the bottom of the screen. The number of rows is calculated automatically. There is the selected image for conversion in the center of the screen, over of which a grid is drawn. To fixate your choice, you need to click on the check mark in the upper right corner on the action bar.

After you have configured everything you need to click on \'Convert\' in the upper right corner on the action bar. After that, a pop-up window with a progress bar will appear.\n\nProgress bar displays a conversion progress - how many crossword puzzles with sizes from a given range have already been tested for solvability. As soon as the solvable crossword found, the conversion finishes. You may click on the standard \'back\' button in the navigation bar to cancel the conversion.
After converting the image into the Japanese Crossword, you can see the result, save and share it.

You can save thumbnail (the solution of the crossword)or unsolved Japanese Crossword by clicking on the 'SAVE' button in the lower left corner and choosing the appropriate item in the dialog.

On saving the miniature, the image size in pixels is equal to the size of the crossword puzzle.

If the save fails, you can try again by pressing the 'RETRY' button on the pop-up bar in the lower part of the screen.

If the save succeed, this bar will contain the path to the file and the 'OPEN' button. By clicking it and choosing the view-application, you can view the saved image.

You can share thumbnail or unsolved Japanese Crossword by clicking on the \'SHARE\' button in the lower right corner and choosing the appropriate item in the dialog. You will be offered with a list of applications through which you can share the image.\n\nIn case of failure, you can try again by pressing the \'RETRY\' button on the pop-up bar in the lower part of the screen.
You can look at the resulting crossword puzzle. In the center of the screen is a solved Japanese Crossword. It can be moved and increased or decreased.
A quick return to the initial screen is available. Just click on the house icon in the upper right corner on the action bar.
